summary:
I am an entrepreneur, scientific advisor, consultant and philanthropic program manager with over a decade of experience in the biotech innovation ecosystem. My strategic leadership is at the intersection of scientific innovation, patient advocacy, and business. A key aspect of my expertise lies in recruiting, building, and effectively managing highly collaborative multidisciplinary teams, comprising top investigators from both industry and academia. My background in life sciences venture capital has provided me with diverse experiences in conducting rigorous analyses of pre-clinical and clinical research, strategic positioning, and company formation. 

My passion lies in building inclusive ecosystems of innovation that catalyze the development of transformative therapies that meet significant unmet medical needs.
headline: Translating STEM innovation into society

publications.description:
Here we report the use of extracellular vesicles, known as arrestin domain containing protein 1
[ARRDC1]-mediated microvesicles (ARMMs), for packaging and intracellular delivery of a
myriad of macromolecules, including the tumor suppressor p53 protein, RNAs, and the
genome-editing CRISPR-Cas9/guide RNA complex. We demonstrate selective recruitment of
these macromolecules into ARMMs. When delivered intracellularly via ARMMs, these
macromolecules are biologically active in recipient cells. P53 delivered via ARMMs induces
DNA damage-dependent apoptosis in multiple tissues in mice. Together, our results provide
proof-of-principle demonstration that ARMMs represent a highly versatile platform for
packaging and intracellular delivery of therapeutic macromolecules.
publications.name: ARMMs as a versatile platform for intracellular delivery of macromolecules

message.text:
https://lnkd.in/dZUSZiku
In graduate school, I was often likened to an "undifferentiated stem cell" due to my broad interest in the unsolved mysteries of biology rather than a single disease area. This explorative passion eventually drew me to focus on Lyme disease research—a field where patients, often feeling neglected by the medical system, suffer in silence from the mysterious sequelae of Lyme infections. This reminded me powerfully of many in my community who felt overlooked and underserved by scientific advances that didn't address their needs.

However, we don’t have a Lyme problem, we have a tick problem. 

As global temperatures continue to rise, the geographic expansion of ticks and the substantial increase of new and reemerging tick-borne diseases (TBDs) have become a major global public health concern. TBDs are not only impacting humans but are also having a staggering impact on the global livestock industry, affecting over 80% of the world's cattle population with annual economic damages caused by TBDs in the livestock sector estimated to be between $13.9 billion and $18.7 billion worldwide.

Thus, although Moderna and Pfizer are developing a Lyme Disease vaccine, these do not protect against the myriad of other TBDs that can be transmitted by just a single deer tick, let alone other disease-carrying ticks. This realization calls to mind the history of the Lyme vaccine, LYMErix™, approved in 1998 but subsequently withdrawn from the market. This history underscores the urgent need for comprehensive solutions that address all facets of the problem.

I am thrilled to share that, in collaboration with Massventures and Brigham and Women's Hospital, we are developing a first-in-class solution aimed at preventing the spread of all tick-borne diseases. Our goal is not just to innovate but to provide hope to those who have felt left behind by scientific advances. I am motivated by the potential of scientific innovation to change lives and offer a beacon of hope to communities globally affected by these increasing threats.

As we continue to push the boundaries of what's possible in the fight against tick-borne diseases, I invite you to join me in this mission to combat tick-borne diseases. Together, we can make a significant impact on global public health
#LymeDisease #PublicHealth #Innovation #CohenGive
#TickBorneIllness #Biotechnology #GlobalHealth #livestock #gatesfoundation

commentary.text: Alister Martin, Thank you so much for your kind words and for being a dynamic leader in our ecosystem! Your work is truly inspiring and I would love to support!
Allison Byers, Thank you so much for your unwavering support and the impact you continue to make! You have always led by example and you continue to inspire me on this Journey. Lets go!!!
Ben Kelly a nail salon generating over $1M in revenue per year! That is amazing feat. The average is around $200-300K/year 🤔
Bobby Brooke Herrera such an inspiration. Thank you for leading by example and continung to make a such a major impact!
